lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/java.main/java/Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Duke.java.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* An extension of the Command class, AddCommand, used to add tasks to taskList.
* @param task the task to be added to constructor
* Returns false to indicate this command does not cause Duke to exit
* Adds tasks to taskList, saves the taskList to Duke.txt file, and displays Ui to show update to taskList.
* @param taskList tasklist that tasks are added to
* @param ui ui that displays results of user commands
* @param storage storage that saves the taskList
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* An abstract command class, other commands inherit the methods execute and isExit for different implementations
* Abstract method with different implementations for other commands
* @param taskList tasklist that contains tasks to be modified, added, or removed
* @param ui ui that displays results of user commands
* @param storage storage that saves or loads the taskList
public abstract void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage);
* Abstract method that determines if the commands will end the program.
* @return true if the command ends the program and vice versa
* An extension of the Command class, DeleteCommand, used to delete tasks to taskList.
* @param integer integer that determines which item is to be deleted
* Returns false to indicate this command does not cause Duke to exit
* Removes tasks from taskList, saves the taskList to Duke.txt file, and displays Ui to show update to taskList.
* @param taskList tasklist that tasks are removed from
* @param ui ui that displays results of user commands
* @param storage storage that saves the taskList
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* An extension of the Command class, ExitCommand, used to exit Duke.
* Returns true to tell that this command makes Duke exit.
* @param taskList tasklist that contains tasks to be modified, added, or removed
* @param ui ui that displays results of user commands
* @param storage storage that saves or loads the taskList
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* FindCommand that inherits Command to search for a keyword
* @param string the string to be initialised
* Returns false to indicate this does not cause program to exit
* Returns the temporary tasklist containing tasks that contains the keyword
* @param taskList the tasklist to be executed
* @param ui the ui to be executed
* @param storage the storage to be executed
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* An extension of the Command class, ListCommand, used to show tasks in taskList.
* Returns false to indicate this command does not cause Duke to exit
* @param taskList tasklist that contains tasks to be modified, added, or removed
* @param ui ui that displays results of user commands
* @param storage storage that saves or loads the taskList
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* An extension of the Command class, MarkCommand, used to mark tasks as done in taskList.
* @param integer integer that determines which item is to be marked as done
* Returns false to indicate this command does not cause Duke to exit
* Marks tasks in taskList, saves the taskList to Duke.txt file, and displays Ui to show update to taskList
* @param taskList tasklist that contains tasks to be marked as done
* @param ui ui that displays results of marking tasks in taskList
* @param storage storage that saves the taskList
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* An extension of the Command class, UnmarkCommand, used to unmark tasks as not done in taskList.
* @param integer integer that determines which item is to be marked as not done
* Returns false to indicate this command does not cause Duke to exit
* Marks tasks in taskList, saves the taskList to Duke.txt file, and displays Ui to show update to taskList.
* @param taskList tasklist that contains tasks to be marked as done
* @param ui ui that displays results of marking tasks in taskList
* @param storage storage that saves the taskList
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Duke class that runs the program
public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
* Class type of exceptions unique to Duke
* @param string shows the different types of exceptions possible
* Parser class for parsing inputs from user
* Turns date from MMM dd yyyy format to yyyy-MM-dd format
* @param string of a MMM dd yyyy format
* Checks what the user types and calls whatever command that the user types corresponds with
* @param fullCommand input from user to be checked against available commands
* @param taskList the taskList to be modified with tasks depending on command
* @return a command that does different tasks depending on user input
public static Command parse(String fullCommand, TaskList taskList) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("OOPS!!! No tasks available!");
throw new DukeException("OOPS!!! Task number does not exist.");
throw new DukeException("OOPS!!! Task number does not exist.");
throw new DukeException("OOPS!!! Task number does not exist.");
throw new DukeException("OOPS!!! Enter keyword to find.");
throw new DukeException("OOPS!!! The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException("OOPS!!! The description of a deadline cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException("OOPS!!! Please use the correct format!");
throw new DukeException("OOPS!!! Please use the correct date format!");
throw new DukeException("OOPS!!! The description of an event cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException("OOPS!!! Please use the correct format!");
throw new DukeException("OOPS!!! Please use the correct date format!");
throw new DukeException("OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
* Storage class that is used to save and load files
* @param filePath it was meant to be used as the file path but I decided to hard code the path instead
* Loads /data/duke.txt and converts it to a command that is parsable, enters the commands line by line
* @return ArrayList of tasks filled with tasks that were previously saved
public static ArrayList<Task> loadFile() throws IOException {
* Saves the tasklist line by line in a duke.txt file
* Returns the string representation of deadline
* @return string that is representation of the deadline
* Returns a string containing task to be done (ie. "Go shopping")
* @return string containing task to be done
* Returns the string representation of event
* @return string that is representation of the event
* Returns a string containing task to be done (ie. "Go shopping")
* @return string containing task to be done
* Task class that contains types of tasks
* Constructor of task and sets task to be not done
* Marks task with X if done and " " if not done
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Returns the string of the task
* Returns the string representation of toDo
* @return string that is representation of toDo
* TaskList class that contains arraylist of tasks
* Empty constructor of TaskList that initializes tasks
* @param tasks takes in tasks and stores it here
* @param task the task to be added to tasks
* @param integer the index of the item that is to be removed
* @return the last task in the tasks arraylist
* Returns the size of the taskList
* Gets the task indexed at integer
* @param integer gets the task indexed here
* Checks if the task array is empty
* @return true if the task array is empty
* Marks task indexed at integer to be done
* Marks task indexed at integer to be not done
* Creates a taskList containing tasks with the keyword string found inside
* @param string the keyword to be found in tasks
* @return a taskList that contains tasks with the string found inside
* Ui class responsible for handling Ui and error messages
System.out.println("_________________________________________________\nBye. Hope to see you again soon!\n"
* Shows message when directory is created
* Shows message when file is created
System.out.println("Creating new duke.txt file under /data/ directory folder.");
* @param taskList the tasks to be shown
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:\n");
* Reads the command entered by user
* @param taskList the taskList that the task is added to
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
* @param taskList the taskList that the task is deleted from
* @param integer the index of the task which is deleted
public void showTaskDeleted(TaskList taskList, int integer) {
System.out.println("Now you have " + (taskList.taskListSize() - 1) + " tasks in the list.");
* Shows when task is marked as done
* @param taskList the taskList that the task is marked from
* @param integer the index of the task which is marked
public void showMarkAsDone(TaskList taskList, int integer) {
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n"
* Shows when task is marked as not done
* @param taskList the taskList that the task is marked from
* @param integer the index of the task which is marked as not done
public void showMarkAsNotDone(TaskList taskList, int integer) {
System.out.println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:\n"
* Displays Ui when task is found
* @param taskList the tasklist to be displayed
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:\n");
